data.method-1-using-curl-command#Method 1: Us:
To disable ECH, execute the following command in your terminal, replacing {ID_ZONE}, {ACCOUNT_EMAIL}, and {GLOBAL_API_KEY} with your data:
curl -X PATCH "https://api.cloudflare.com/client/v4/zones/{ID_ZONE}/settings/ech" \ -H "X-Auth-Email: {ACCOUNT_EMAIL}" \ -H "X-Auth-Key: {GLOBAL_API_KEY}" \ -H "Content-Type: application/json" \ --data '{"id":"ech","value":"off"}'Example:
curl -X PATCH "https://api.cloudflare.com/client/v4/zones/abc123def456/settings/ech" \ -H "X-Auth-Email: user@example.com" \ -H "X-Auth-Key: c2547eb745079dac9320b638f5e225cf483cc5cfdda41" \ -H "Content-Type: application/json" \ --data '{"id":"ech","value":"off"}'Upon successful execution, you‚Äôll receive a JSON response confirming the setting change.

data.why-disable-ech#Why Disable ECH?:
Roskomnadzor (Russian telecommunications regulator) has blocked the Encrypted Client Hello (ECH) technology, causing issues for Cloudflare users in Russia. Moreover, Cloudflare has forcibly enabled this technology for all users, including those on the free tier.
This guide will show you how to disable ECH for your domain using the Cloudflare API.
For users from Russia: Disabling ECH may be necessary to ensure your website‚Äôs accessibility for Russian users due to Roskomnadzor‚Äôs blocking of this technology.

How to Use Your Domain Instead of an IP Address?Linking a domain to your server is necessary to make the connection process simpler and faster. Typically, an IP address is used for connection, which can be long and difficult to remember (123.45.67.89:1234).
If you link a domain, for example, play.mhcore.xyz, it will be easier for players to remember, which can help attract an audience to your server.
Why do you need this?
Easy to remember: play.mhcore.xyz instead of 123.45.67.89:25565 Professional appearance for your server Ability to change hosting without changing the address for players

data.console-commands-for-minecraft-server-co:
Console Commands for Minecraft Server: Complete Administrator‚Äôs GuideIn the world of Minecraft, server management is not just about launching a file and watching players build their block empires. It‚Äôs an art of balance between creativity, security, and community dynamics. If you want to turn your server into a magnet for loyal players, knowledge of console commands will become your secret weapon. They allow you to instantly respond to incidents, configure gameplay, and maintain an atmosphere where every visit feels like an adventure.
Imagine: a new player complains about lag, and you save the world and restart the server with one movement. Or a suspicious user starts griefing ‚Äî and they‚Äôre already on the ban list. These commands are the foundation of professional administration. We‚Äôll break them down by categories: from basic access control to fine-tuning the world.
Important Notation:
for required parameters (e.g., ) [Square brackets] for optional additions (e.g., [reason]) In server console, commands are written without slash (/), unlike in-game chat Don‚Äôt type the brackets ‚Äî they‚Äôre just for understanding Ready? Let‚Äôs dive into the Minecraft codex!
data.multiplayer-management-commands-server-c:
These tools are your shield and sword in the fight for order. They help filter the audience, monitor activity, and ensure stability.
Basic ControlWhitelistBans & KicksBasic Server ControlCommand Description Example list Shows all online players on the server list save-all Force saves the entire world. Saves from losses during crashes save-all save-off Disables automatic saving (saves resources during tests) save-off save-on Re-enables auto-saving save-on stop Instantly stops the server stop Whitelist ManagementCommand Description Example whitelist add Adds to whitelist whitelist add NewFriend whitelist remove Removes from whitelist whitelist remove OldPlayer whitelist list Shows complete whitelist whitelist list whitelist on/off Enables/disables whitelist mode whitelist on whitelist reload Reloads whitelist after file edits whitelist reload Bans & KicksCommand Description Example ban [reason] Adds player to server blacklist ban Griefer123 "Chat spam" ban-ip Blocks access by IP to server ban-ip 192.168.1.1 kick [reason] Kicks player from server kick TrollUser "Server rules" pardon Removes player block pardon ReformedGriefer pardon-ip Unblocks IP from blacklist pardon-ip 192.168.1.1 banlist Shows list of banned players banlist

If you‚Äôre an OP, you become the king of the server. They allow you to partially manage the server: from distributing items, adding to the list to blocking bad players. In chat, add / before the command.

If you intentionally want to allow cracked/offline clients to connect, follow these steps. Remember: this increases security risks and can let malicious users impersonate admins ‚Äî follow the steps carefully.
Open panel.qwer-host.xyz and select your server. Go to the ‚ÄúFiles‚Äù tab and open server.properties. Find the line online-mode=true and change it to online-mode=false. Save the file. Restart the server. IMPORTANT:
YOU MUST INSTALL AN AUTHENTICATION PLUGIN (e.g., AuthMe, xAuth or another trusted plugin). Without it, anyone can join with any nickname ‚Äî including admin names ‚Äî and perform any actions. Use a whitelist and manage permissions via trusted permission plugins (such as LuckPerms). Make backups before making changes. While this setting allows non-premium players to join, we strongly recommend purchasing legitimate licenses for all players and using offline-mode only when absolutely necessary.

data.why-are-automatic-restarts-needed#Why Ar:
We often receive support requests asking: ‚ÄúHow do I set up automatic Minecraft server restarts?‚Äù We listen to our clients, and that‚Äôs why we‚Äôve prepared this tutorial for you.

data.1-open-the-backups-section#1. Open the B: Go to the ‚ÄúBackups‚Äù section in your server control panel.

data.backup-best-practices#Backup Best Practi: Regularity ‚Äî create backups regularly (daily or weekly depending on server activity) Planning ‚Äî use automatic restart scheduling to create backups during off-hours Naming ‚Äî give backups clear names with dates and descriptions (e.g., ‚Äúbackup-2025-10-23-before-update‚Äù) Verification ‚Äî periodically check that backups are being created correctly Storage ‚Äî don‚Äôt delete old backups immediately ‚Äî keep several recent copies just in case
data.creating-a-backup-through-control-panel#: Our website panel.qwer-host.xyz provides the ability to create backups directly in the control panel.
data.how-to-protect-yourself#How to Protect Y: That‚Äôs what backups are for! With their help, you can easily restore all data and continue enjoying the game.
data.restoring-from-a-backup#Restoring From a:
If you need to restore your server from a backup:
Go to the ‚ÄúBackups‚Äù section Find the needed backup in the list Click the three dots to the right of the backup Select ‚ÄúRestore‚Äù Confirm the action Restoring from a backup will replace all current server files with data from the backup copy. Make sure you selected the correct backup!Regular backups are a guarantee of your project‚Äôs safety. Don‚Äôt neglect this feature!
data.why-are-backups-so-important#Why Are Bac:
A backup (data copy) is essential for any Minecraft server that aims to become an interesting project.
Imagine this situation: you created a server, installed many different plugins and interesting mods, spent days on configuration, and also built survival houses. And then‚Ä¶ a sudden error, some failure, or someone deliberately harmed your project ‚Äî and everything is lost.
This happens very often, and all the players‚Äô efforts go to waste. People lose motivation and don‚Äôt want to do anything anymore.

data.how-to-accept-eula#How to Accept EULA?: There are two ways to accept the license agreement:

data.what-is-eula#What is EULA?:
EULA (End User License Agreement) is an end-user license agreement between you and the Minecraft developer (Mojang Studios).
EULA describes:

data.common-causes#Common Causes:
Before proceeding with diagnostics, check the following common causes of high ping:
Unloaded chunks ‚Äî ensure the server can handle chunk loading properly Paper AntiXray in mode 2 or 3 ‚Äî these modes can create additional load. Try switching to mode 1 or disabling it If fixing these causes doesn‚Äôt help, proceed to the next step.

data.problem-description#Problem Description:
If you encounter this error when trying to connect to a server:
Invalid signature for profile public key.Try restarting your game.agj$a: Missing profile public key.This server requires secure profiles.This is related to secure profile verification in newer Minecraft versions. Here‚Äôs the solution!
data.solution#Solution: You need to change a setting in the server configuration file server.properties.
data.step-by-step-instructions#Step-by-Step I: Open the control panel at panel.qwer-host.xyz and select your server. Go to the ‚ÄúFiles‚Äù tab and find the server.properties file. Open the file for editing. Find the line: enforce-secure-profile=trueChange the value to false: enforce-secure-profile=falseSave the file. Restart the server. After the restart, try connecting again ‚Äî the error should be gone.

/en/docs/server-setup/invalid-signature-.title: Invalid signature for profile public key ‚Äî How to Fix?

data.connecting-a-database-to-a-plugin#Connec:
Now let‚Äôs move on to connecting the database to a plugin. As an example, we will use the CoreProtect plugin.
Go to the Files tab in the plugin directory (plugins/CoreProtect).
Open config.yml.
Find the data storage settings. First, you need to enable MySQL support in the plugin. In this case, you need to set use-mysql: true
Copy the necessary information into the corresponding fields. It is recommended to put the password in quotes " ", as it may contain special characters. Also pay attention to the database name - it must exactly match the value from the panel. Save the config and restart the server.
data.creating-a-database#Creating a Database:
To create a database:
Go to the server control panel.
Navigate to the ‚ÄúDatabases‚Äù tab.
Create a new database and come up with a name for it according to the plugin you are going to use it for.
Click on the ‚Äúeye‚Äù icon to see the database parameters. Done! You have created a database.
data.what-are-mysql-databases-for-and-how-to-: MySQL databases are used to store plugin data and synchronize data between servers in a network. Data stored in the database does not take up space on the server disk.
data.working-with-other-plugins#Working with: Other plugins work the same way, but there are some exceptions where databases are placed in a separate .yml file. Everything is done logically - just look for a place where you need to enter the fields that are given to you in the control panel.

data.1-choosing-the-wrong-plan#1. Choosing th: This is the most common mistake among beginners. To keep the server stable and avoid overload, choose a plan that fits your load. For example, to run a server comfortably without plugins on version 1.20.2, you need at least 2 GB of RAM.
data.2-installing-a-huge-number-of-modsplugin: If you install too many plugins or mods, don‚Äôt be surprised when something breaks. Plugins can conflict and cause errors. If you plan to add many additions, proceed carefully and be prepared to buy more resources.
data.3-ignoring-console-errors#3. Ignoring co: You must check the console for errors and warnings. Sometimes something may crash or throw an error related to a component. Read the error, identify the plugin mentioned, and search the web. In 99% of cases a solution exists. If it‚Äôs a warning, translate it and take notice.
data.4-not-using-the-knowledge-base-and-askin: Learn to google and check our knowledge base. Almost every basic (and not so basic) question has an answer. Learn and understand how things work.
data.5-copying-servers-as-is#5. Copying serve: Copying server setups or downloading ready-made packs while only renaming them is short-sighted. Before creating a server, have a unique idea or concept ‚Äî that will help your project grow.
data.6-ignoring-backups#6. Ignoring backups: Never neglect backups. Regular snapshots will save you from crashes, corrupted worlds, or plugin update issues.
data.7-updating-plugins-and-server-without-te: Updates can break compatibility. Always test new plugin or server versions on a local or staging server before applying them to production.
data.8-poor-security-configuration#8. Poor se: Leaving default passwords, not setting proper access rights, or opening unnecessary ports makes your server vulnerable. Configure operator permissions and use strong passwords.
data.9-incorrect-java-optimization-and-settin:
Improper Java startup parameters (heap, garbage collection) and lack of configuration optimization can cause lag and memory leaks. Follow recommendations for your server version and use proven startup templates.
If you have questions, contact our support or check the help section.
